name: Ustilago maydis
Relationship: Compare: SECALE; SABIN.; ZEA ITALICA. (Possess curative properties in skin diseases, particularly in psoriasis and eczema rubrum. Mania for bathing. Impulse to suicide, particularly by drowning. Easily angered. Appetite increased, voracious, alternating with disgust for food. Pyrosis, nausea, vomiting, better drinking wine.)

Head: Full feeling
Nervous headache from menstrual irregularities
Very depressed
Aching in eyeballs, with much lachrymation
Fever: Pulse at first accelerated then enfeebled
Female: Oozing of dark blood, clotted, forming long black strings
Profuse menses after miscarriage; discharge of blood from slightest provocation; bright red; partly clotted
Extremities: Muscular contractions, especially of lower limbs
Muscular debility, SENSATION OF BOILING WATER ALONG THE BACK
Male: Dull pain in lumbar region, with great despondency and mental irritability
Spermatorrhoea, with erotic fancies and amorous dreams
Emissions, with irresistible tendency to masturbation

details: Flabby condition of uterus. Hemorrhage. Congestion to various parts, especially at climacteric. Crusta lactea. (VIOL TRICH.)
